tool.name: SAGA.shapes_grid.3
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayGRIDS True isArrayPOLYGONS False output_data_SHAPES $output_data_SHAPES name SAGA.shapes_grid.3 GRIDS $GRIDS POLYGONS $POLYGONS NODATA $NODATA TYPE $TYPE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_SHAPES $OutputSection_SHAPES.outputType_SHAPES transmissionMode_SHAPES $OutputSection_SHAPES.transmissionMode_SHAPES

param.name: GRIDS
param.label: Grids
param.help: Grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png, tiff

param.name: POLYGONS
param.label: Polygons
param.help: Polygons The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_SHAPES
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_SHAPES
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool saves grid values to point (grid nodes) or polygon (grid cells) shapes. Optionally only points can be saved, which are contained by polygons of the specified shapes layer. In addition, it is possible to exclude all cells that are coded NoData in the first grid of the grid list.
